Text.Value: But she's still alive? We need her head.

EditorData.NodeContext: Delighted on first word - then enthusiastic and determined

Text.Value: It's all I have, but it's yours if you stop her. Bring me her head, and Tyr will consider her crimes repaid.
She's slaughtered countless refugees fleeing the Absolute. Yesterday, she butchered an entire family. We were lucky to survive our encounter with her.
I met her. She says you're the fiends, and I believe her.
I suppose she sought cover for her own crimes by accusing us.
Why did she think you agents of Zariel?
Here's her head. Just like you asked.
She ran toward the river when she saw we were merely wounded - not dead. Down the hill from here.
Truly? I believe I've met her.
A devilish lie. She nearly killed me with her hellacious flames, and now she's sent you to finish the job.
Block the doors.
I've already dealt with her. She's dead.
Our lord Tyr sent us in pursuit of that devil. She had already butchered a family fleeing the armies of the Absolute by the time we caught up with her.
We are paladins of Tyr, sworn to protect those in need. He sent us to hunt Karlach down, but she was too vicious for us.
Truth and justice, brother. My oath is in Tyr's name. I am sorry to hear about the fate of your mission.
She wasn't. I may not be able to convince you, but Tyr's blessing is now upon you. Let him strike me down if I take his word in vain.
It isn't like a devil to use their brawn instead of their brains.
I thank you for taking our side. You had no reason to trust us, yet your faith spared us a grisly end.

EditorData.logicalname: Sided with Paladins, have not met them yet.

Text.Value: Leave.
Our scouts told us you'd come. The devil's ally. Come to finish us, have you?
I believe... that is...

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Martin K - Player takes out Karlach's decapitaded head, tosses on ground
EditorData.SFXTags: [PK] A tud as a decapitated head hits the ground

Text.Value: You must mean Karlach. I know the truth about who you are.
Why should I believe you?
You've saved our souls. It's a debt that can never truly be repaid.
*That's Karlach all right. If you believe her story, these so-called paladins are lying.*
Zariel will find this all terribly funny.
Do not be swayed.
The monster's name is Karlach - my sworn prey. I will hunt her down.
Let me help. I can hunt down this monster.
Believe what you will, but do it in silence. We have wounded to tend to - and a return home to plan.
Bring me her head, and I'll give you my blade. It carries Tyr's blessing - and you will have earned it by carrying out his justice.

EditorData.NodeContext: Making a reasonable bargain. 'Tyr' (TEER) is his god

Text.Value: Thank you. As promised, here is my blade, blessed by Tyr.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Aders] Take his sword from his back and look at it (plz, check the lenght of this node before shooting it. Anders talk while doing so) <SimonG>

Text.Value: Tyr protect you. Be on your watch. There's a devil in the guise of a one-horned tiefling haunting the Risen Road.
She wasn't. Let me prove it to you with a gift.
Just yesterday, the devil Karlach slaughtered countless refugees. An entire family met their end at her hands - including a pregnant mother.
Believe me, she's no tiefling, but a devil. We were lucky to escape.
The fiend may have been a tiefling once, but she belongs to Avernus now. I wish it were not so, and I bear no grudge against your people.
It was my duty to protect you.
Well?

EditorData.NodeContext: enthusiastically greeting a player he believes is a fellow cultist

Text.Value: The only head that will roll is yours.
I've met her. She said you were servants of Zariel sent to take her back to Avernus.
I'm sure she's invented a fascinating history of our crimes. The truth is far simpler.
If you serve the Lord of Justice, prove it. Recite the Creed of the Left Hand.
Your actions saved many souls - Tyr be with you.
I've been called a devil before. Are you sure this tiefling is what you say?
Wh-who's there? Please - keep your distance. You're welcome to shelter here, but we've grave injuries to tend to.

EditorData.logicalname: Karlach not recruited - Has not met

Text.Value: If that's true, this is the first glimmer of hope we've had for a long while. But I'll need proof.

EditorData.NodeContext: He's just been told the fiend he hunts is dead. Surprise and hope.

Text.Value: But here is my blade, blessed by Tyr. I hope it keeps you safe, and brings your enemies to justice.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Aders] Take his sword from his back and give it to the Player (plz, check the lenght of this node before shooting it. Anders talk while doing so) <SimonG>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Takes out his sword, and presents it to player, player takes sword.

Text.Value: I have other things to deal with.
We owe you every gratitude. If we had something - anything - to give, we would. But our thanks - and Tyr's gratitude - will have to suffice for now.
But here is my blade, blessed by Tyr. I hope it keeps you safe, and brings your enemies to justice.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Aders] Take his sword from his back and give it to the Player (plz, check the lenght of this node before shooting it. Anders talk while doing so) <SimonG>

Text.Value: Rest easy. I'll only stay a short time.
I met her by the river, not far from here.
I understand. But if you see the fiend, be on your guard. She's dangerous.
First I was burned within in inch of my life, and now I'm stuck playing pantomime. I can't take it anymore.

EditorData.NodeContext: the mask drops; he reveals his true nature. not a suffering paladin but an agent of evil

Text.Value: It isn't too late to do the right thing, though.
We are paladins of Tyr, Lord of Justice. He sent us after an infernal being, straight out of the Nine Hells, hiding in the form of a one-horned tiefling - Karlach.
She's dead. Finally we can rest.

EditorData.logicalname: Sided with Paladins, have met them already

Text.Value: Fool. All you'll get is a broken skull.
Perhaps you've decided to chase down the fiend after all?
I disagree. I think you're something far worse.
Then you'd be very stupid indeed.

EditorData.NodeContext: HE suddenly drops the 'woe is me' act.

Text.Value: Who - or what - attacked you?
If you serve the Lord of Justice, prove it. Recite the Creed of the Left Hand.
That depends on you. Are you what she says you are?
A fellow paladin? What fortune. You might be able to succeed where we failed.

EditorData.logicalname: Sided with Paladins, Karlach is dead hasmet

Text.Value: She only has one horn, and she looks like she could rip your arms off with her bare hands. Hard to miss.
*One horn. He means Karlach - there is no doubting it.*
A tollhouse, once upon a time. Now a house of respite for those of us burned by a devil.
I heard a tiefling called Karlach nearly roasted you to death.
Say I buy your story. What then?
Very well. I'll bring you her head.
What is this place?
Agents of... let me guess. The devil Karlach herself told you that profane lie.
I'll think about it.
You've saved our souls. It's a debt that can never truly be repaid.
Then you're lucky to be alive.

EditorData.NodeContext: surprised on first sentence, then determined - Zariel is the arch-devil he serves

Text.Value: One horn? Then you mean Karlach. Archdevil's bootlicker.
This is the Sword of Justice, blessed by Tyr. I've wielded it since I swore my oath.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Martin K - Takes out sword and holds it up

Text.Value: That's right. I'm sending you back to Avernus where you belong.
Remind me - how will I recognise her?
Cut the act. I know what you are. Agents of Zariel here to collect an asset.
Leave.
We were lucky to survive our encounter with her.
Maybe I was too hasty. Maybe she was right about you.
A devil - the most deadly foe we've yet encountered.
She's slaughtered countless refugees fleeing the Absolute. Yesterday, she butchered an entire family without mercy.
Drop the act - you're no paladin. You serve the archdevil Zariel.
Karlach is going back to Avernus, and if she won't go quietly, she dies. It looks like I'll have to kill you first, which I quite look forward to. Bye-bye.
Now that she softened you up, I'll finish you off.
May the Just God guide you.
Any sign of the tiefling fiend?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Attach sword of justice to waist
EditorData.NodeContext: enthusiastically greeting a player he believes is a fellow cultist

Text.Value: A grim business - but justice has been served. May Tyr watch over you.
*This could be the work of a devil, but they collect souls through cunning, not carnage.*
Look at me. The devil nearly burned me to the bone. A normal tiefling like yourself couldn't do that without powerful magics. She's something far worse.
Look at me. The devil nearly burned me to the bone. A tiefling couldn't do that without powerful magics. She's something far worse.
You know her. Which means you know what the fiend's capable of.
To arms, comrades. We are discovered.
Tsk. Poor Karlach. Allied with the first sap she met, who will be so quickly destroyed.

EditorData.NodeContext: The jig is up and Anders' demeanor changes. He drops the veil of the lie of the kindly paladin and reveals himself for what he is

Text.Value: She must pay for her crimes. If you capture her, you will have served Tyr where we could not.
Bless you in all your doings - in Justice's name.
We are paladins of Tyr, Lord of Justice. He sent us after an infernal being, straight out of the Nine Hells, hiding in the form of a one-horned tiefling.
*You recognise the description - the burning tiefling you met by the river.*
But she's dead now. She can't hurt anyone anymore. You are our protector - Tyr's blessings are upon you.
I wish you and yours well, but I must be on my way soon.
Before you go - I wouldn't be a proper paladin if I didn't try to enlist your help in a righteous battle.
It's sacred... the most valuable thing I've ever held. I hope it serves you as well as it served me.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Aders] give his sword to the Player (need to fit with previous node) (plz, check the lenght of this node before shooting it. Anders talk while doing so) <SimonG>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Takes out his sword, and presents it to player, player takes sword.
EditorData.NodeContext: with reverence - he's passing us a holy weapon, with awe and regret to be losing it

Text.Value: She bested us once, and would have finished the job if not for you.
You're a terrible liar.
Say I buy your story. What then?
She's dead, but I couldn't retrieve her head.
Where is this devil?
Indeed. She's a uniquely vicious case. All the more reason she must be stopped.

Synopsis:
These paladins signed their pact with Zariel for riches and power and serve her with relish. They've agreed to capture and kill Karlach, one of the origin characters.

This cultist is the leader of the group. He's friendly, but badly injured after his fight with Karlach.
